src:
Joaquín Sabina es casa
El cantant va demanar la mà a Jimena Coronado amb el genoll a terra i en vers

07 Nov 2019, 15:14





Joaquín Sabina es casa / INSTAGRAM

Després de vint anys junts, Joaquín Sabina ha demanat de casar-se a Jimena Coronado. Així ho ha revelat el seu gran amic i company d'escenari els últims temps, Joan Manuel Serrat, mentre eren plegats en una entrevista al programa argentí Teleshow. "Va ser fa pocs dies, quan li va demanar de casar-se a Jimena. Es va agenollar i li va regalar un anell", va dir el cantant català durant la conversa. Una explicació que va deixar parat Sabina, que automàticament li va recriminar que aquesta informació no s'hauria d'haver fet pública. Tot i això, una vegada revelada el cantant d'Úbeda va afegir: "Tinc 70 anys, el dia que la Jime en va complir 50 vaig doblegar les cames i en vers..."
Joaquín Sabina i Jimena Coronado es van conèixer el 1999 durant una entrevista en una habitació de l'Hotel Sheraton de Lima a la qual ella va acudir com a fotògrafa. Coronado és filla d'un expresident del Banc Central de la Reserva del Perú. La parella no ha tingut fills. El cantant sí que n'havia tingut amb la seva anterior parella, Isabel Oliart, filla de l'exministre d'Indústria de la UCD, Alberto Oliart. Durant la seva llarga relació van tenir la Rocío i la Carmela, les protagonistes de les dues últimes cançons d'amor que ha escrit l'artista, com ell mateix sol explicar indicant l'edat que té.
text:
Joaquín Sabina is home
The singer asked for Jimena Coronado's hand with her knee on the floor and in verse

07 Nov 2019, 15:14





Joaquín Sabina is home / INSTAGRAM

After twenty years together, Joaquín Sabina has asked to marry Jimena Coronado. This has been revealed by his great friend and stage partner in recent times, Joan Manuel Serrat, while they were together in an interview with the Argentine Teleshow program. "It was a few days ago, when he asked to marry Jimena. He fell down and gave him a ring," said the Catalan singer during the conversation. An explanation left by Sabina, who automatically criticized him that this information should not have been made public. However, once the singer from Úbeda revealed, he added: "I am 70 years old, on the day Jime turned 50 I folded my legs and in the end ..."
Joaquín Sabina and Jimena Coronado met in 1999 during an interview in a room at the Sheraton Hotel in Lima, where she attended as a photographer. Coronado is the daughter of a former president of the Central Bank of the Reserva del Perú. The couple have not had children. The singer had had her with her former partner, Isabel Oliart, daughter of the former Minister of Industry of the UCD, Alberto Oliart. During his long relationship, Rocío and Carmela, the protagonists of the last two songs of love written by the artist, as he himself usually explain, indicate the age he has.
